Summary Note:
Joke Geertje Mulders and the RM are cousins, having grown up together in Amsterdam. Their familial bond has naturally extended into a professional partnership built on mutual respect and shared values.
Having worked for over 29 years, Joke Geertje Mulders brings a wealth of experience and expertise to her current role. She is known for her strategic thinking and ability to drive results.
Looking for a private bank with a deep understanding of wealth management, she joined Julius Baer for its expertise.
Family Background: Joke Geertje Mulders is married to Veenhoven. They do not have any children.
Education Background:
Joke earned her secondary school diploma from Katholieke Scholengemeenschap Hoofddorp in 1990.
After that, she went on to study at Maastricht University School of Business and Economics until 1996.
She pursued addtionally further eduaction by attending Leiden University and graduating in 2001.
Occupation History:
With a career spanning nearly 29 years, Joke Geertje Mulders has established herself as a key player in the industry.
At ABN AMRO Group N.V., Joke Geertje Mulders held the position of Investment Banker from 1996 to 2000, developing essential skills in the field.
She then transitioned to ING Group N.V. as a Private Equity Investor, leveraging her expertise to drive results from 2002 to 2007.
She spent 16 years working as a Hedge Fund Manager at SNS Bank N.V., refining her expertise and building a strong network.
Wealth Summary:
While working, she saved 540000 EUR, which she used to build a diversified investment portfolio.
She has house located in Assen, worth 2030000 EUR.

In addition to her primary residence, she owns flat in Almere worth 1290000 EUR.

In 2012, she received an inheritance of 1440000 EUR from her late grandfather, who was a prominent Hedge Fund Manager, and has since invested it in various assets.
Client Summary: In light of the above, we are optimistic about the client's financial future and career progression and are eager to welcome her as a new client.
